chargeHist.descr: Misappropriate Buyer Prepayments Under Home Improvement Contract

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor (fr. Person/Corpse), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond of $1,000 posted to be applied to restitution and paid to victims by Clerk of Court. Balance of Restitution in the amount of $16,415.20 to be paid in increments of $200.00 per month commencing May 1, 2017 and each month until May 1, 2018 when restitution payments are to be made in increments of no less than $400.00 per month until paid in full. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is not to serve in a fiduciary capacity. Defendant is not to contract for his services. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with E. Schneider and/or C. Thern, as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.

Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 10:22 a.m. Defendant Matthew J Bauer in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion by the State to Revoke Huber Privileges. There is no Good Time Credit as it is a conditional jail sentence. DE admits receipt of the motion. The DE does wish to contest the allegations in the motion. CO Robert Kamholz sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by DA Blader. The witness identifies the DE. Exhibit 1 marked and entered. Witness testifies to exhibit 1. Exhibit 1 received by the Court. Exhibit 2 marked and entered. Witness testifies to Exhibit 2. Exhibit 2 received by the Court.   Exhibit 3 marked and entered. Witness testifies to Exhibit 3. Exhibit 3 received by the Court.  DE questions the witness. DE sworn in for testimony. Testimony given by the DE. The Court finds that a violation has occurred. The Court orders that all work release privileges be revoked for the duration of the sentence.
Motion hearing on June 1, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Revoke Work Release Privileges and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit

records.addlTxt:
9:08 am cases called-16CF11 & 16CF89. Defendant Matthew J Bauer in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by both counsel. No additions or corrections by Attorney Ulrich. ADA Anderson makes statement regarding corrections to page 7. Victim impact statement reveiwed along with statement of ADA Anderson on behalf of the victims.  Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Ulrich. Further argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 16CF11-SWD and places on probation for 4 years. CONDITIONS: 10 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. To begin no later than May 1, 2017. Court does not object to a jail transfer. Defendant is not to serve in a fiduciary capacity. Defendant is not to contract for his services. No contact with victims E. Schneider and/or C. Thern as named in the complaint. $17,415.20 Restitution to be paid in increments of no less than $200 per month commencing May 1, 2017 and $400 per month commencing May 1, 2018 until paid in full. AODA and follow through, Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety, is not to be on the premises of any bars, and is prohibited form possessing or ingesting any impairing substance not prescribed by a treating physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample and surcharge. Court orders bond on file in 16CF89 to be applied to restitution in 16CF11.
16CF89 (Ct 1)- SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety, is not to be on the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing or ingesting any impairing substance not prescribed by a treating physician. Defendant is not to serve in a fiduciary capacity. Defendant is not to contract for his services. No contact with victims E. Schneider and/or C. Thern. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample and surcharge. 
16CF89 (Ct 2)- 12 days WCJ, with credit for 9 days served. $1,429.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 13 month DL revocation, 13 month IID. OWI Assessment. Appeal Right Given.
Sentencing hearing on April 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.

9:14 am cases called. 16CF11, 16CF89, 16CF242, & 16CF243. Defendant Matthew J Bauer in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding resolution and matter set on the calendar. Statement by ADA Anderson-history of case stated on record. Court questions Attorney Ulrich. Statement by Attorney Ulrich regarding the matter-requests matter set for trial. Discussion regarding offer extended. ADA Anderson states offer on record. Attorney Ulrich states due to several different offers regarding restitution defendant is hoping to get some restitution paid. Court makes statement to defendant regarding cases. Court recesses at 9:25 am for counsel and defendant to discuss resolution or matter being set for trial. 
10:05 am cases recalled. Same appearances-Statement by ADA Anderson-he believes pleas will be entered today and matter will be adjourned for sentencing with a request with PSI. 16CF89-Preliminary hearing discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Ulrich confirms receipt, waives formal reading and stated defendant will enter pleas to Count 1 & 2.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 16CF11, No Contest to Count 1 & 2 of 16CF89.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 3 of 16CF89. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 & 3 of 16CF11, Count 4 & 5 of 16CF89, and 16CF242 & 16CF243 entirely. Court orders a PSI to be completed and matter set for sentencing.

11:54 am cases called. 16CF242, 16CF243, 16CF11, & 16CF89. Defendant Matthew J. Bauer in court with Attorney Ulrich on 16CF89.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Ulrich regarding status of matters and request for plea & sentencing in early January.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Ex-Parte letter returned to M. Gutsmeidl

Case called @ 2:14 p.m. Defendant Matthew J Bauer in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint. Counsel requests clarification of the bond. Defendant is not to act in any fiduciary capacity.  Not prevented from accepting contractor work, though is prohibited from accepting any pre-paid funds.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Matthew J Bauer in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def requests counsel and is going to try to retain his own counsel.  Not currently working due to the weather.  He requests approx 30 days to obtain counsel, plans to retain Bill Lennon from Oshkosh.   Court will adjourn IA to allow Def to obtain counsel.  ADA argues for $5000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement by Def as to bond request.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $1741.52
